data.title: VMware has acquired Zimbra
data.text:
Went to the VMware forum yesterday and they said it was up for grabs from Yahoo, VMware bought it a couple of months ago.

VMware also purchased SpringSource meaning they now own Tomcat Server.

What this means: secretly (think of Covert OPS) taking Microsoft’s Exchange, IIS markets!!!

What do you guys think?

I hope it means that they develop an easily deployed Zimbra appliance without having to mess with any OS variations or bothering to maintain an OS. Of course that would probably be only the paid products, not FOSS.

I hadn’t heard about the Tomcat acquisition. Sounds like they have the beginnings of a nice assault.

Only you knew about it!

Everybody in the audience was like: WTH, when did this happen?

SpringSource was acquired months ago but Zimbra only 2 months ago.

humphrey, they’re developing that atm. When it’s ready I’m sure they’ll spend some ad money to make it known to the masses. They said they’re integrating everything…pretty interesting stuff will come from them in the future.

http://blogs.vmware.com/console/2010/01/vmware-to-acquire-zimbra.html

Tomcat is free but 85% of the developers are from SpringSource…so… they secretly own Tomcat and can make things the way they want.
